name: Version 2.1.5
body:
This critical bugfix release contains an updated parser which has better support for Heroes of the Storm 2.0, in addition to not completely crashing the replay handling on failure.
# Issues fixed

#157 - StormParser bypassed fallbacks and did not support Heroes 2.0

name: Version 2.1.4
body:
This bugfix release fixes the Battle Lobby for macOS after Blizzard changed their temporary file locations. It also tunes the My Documents detection on Windows systems.
# Issues fixed

#148 - Documents folders were not detected if the user had a dash in any folder
#154 - Battle Lobby did not display on macOS

name: Version 2.1.3
body:
This bugfix release reenables Brawl uploads, as they are now supported by Hotslogs. It also fixes an issue with the .jar file generation.

# Issues fixed

#138 - Brawls were being held back from upload, but Hotslogs now supports it.
#143 - Uber-jars were not properly generated

name: Version 2.1.2
body:
This bugfix release fixes issues with Windows drive labels, and with uploading Brawl replays.

# Issues fixed

~~#136~~ - Windows allows lower case drive labels, but the app does not.
~~#138~~ - Brawls are uploaded even though Hotslogs.com doesn't support it.

# Where's the .jar file?

We're having an issue with Spring Boot and "uber jars". This is typically resolved using a special Spring Boot plugin, but this seems to be incompatible with the JavaFX Maven Plugin we use for native bundles.

name: Version 2.1.1
body:
This bugfix release fixes the issue with invalid version numbers that causes the application to think there's an available update while you're still running the latest version

# Issues fixed

~~#130~~ - Application version can be not semantic number version compliant.

name: Version 2.1.0
body:
This feature release brings a Battle Lobby feature that allows users to get a preview of the currently active match in the app. It also displays a link to display more detailed information on HotsLogs.com

# New features

~~#118~~ - The account list now automatically selects the account with the most recently played match - thanks @rogusdev!
~~#127~~ - The application now halts uploading and display match information when in a match
~~#126~~/UNTRACKED - The code base has been massively overhauled to use a Spring context instead of Guice. We've also modularized the application views.

name: Version 2.0.5
body:
This is the final bugfix release for the 2.0 branch of the application. Development is now shifting fully to the next feature release, in lieu of critical issues that arise.

# Issues fixed

~~#113~~ - If replays were deleted while queued for upload and the application was running, the application would break down
~~#115~~ - Removed replays were not deleted from the database on startup
~~#119~~ - An update to the HotsLogs hero model broke our hero list - this has been resolved.

## What happened to 2.0.4?

While fixing #115, we introduced a pretty critical bug that would've deleted our tracking state for all your replays on every restart if you had multiple accounts. This wasn't discovered until we had finished preparing to release 2.0.4 and were doing final testing. Therefore, the release was skipped.

name: Version 2.0.3
body:
This is the release of version 2.0.3. This bugfix release fixes two issues related to replay folder locations and failed uploads that later succeeded not being saved properly.

## Issues fixed
- ~~#107~~ Previously failed uploads were not tagged as successful uploads after they did succeed.
- ~~#108~~ Windows user with dots(.) in their username could not use the application

name: Version 2.0.2
body:
This is the release of version 2.0.2. This bugfix release fixes an issue, which was introduced by 2.0.1 causing an abnormal amount of "uploaded replays" to appear.

## Issues fixed
- ~~#96~~ Replay files were duplicated, if multiple accounts and / or multiple regions were used on a single machine

name: Version 2.0.1
body:
This is the release of version 2.0.1 This bugfix release fixes issues related to the new way we save statuses.

## Issues fixed
- ~~#80/#81~~ - 2.0.0 did not start on some systems due to an improper uniqueness check for files.
- ~~#92~~ - Crash on start if replay files were deleted.
- ~~#93~~ - Some file states were not persisted properly and required a double pass through the uploader. Files were however only actually uploaded once.
- ~~UNTAGGED~~ - Fixed an issue where using both the jar and native package would flag the database as corrupted.

name: Version 2.0.0
body:
This is the release of version 2.0. This major release adds a more efficient and upgradeable storage system for tracking which replays have been uploaded to HotSLogs.com. We've also added a [replay parser](https://github.com/eivindveg/HotSReplayParser) that allows us to check the status of a replay instead of uploading it in many cases.

## Homebrew Cask

OSX users may now install the application with the `brew cask install hots-replay-uploader` command.

## New features
- #48/#50 - New application name: HotS Replay Uploader - please uninstall HotSLogs UploaderFX. The new application will remove tracking files for the previous version automatically. We also have our own new shiny logo thanks to @MathiasOki.
- #51/#61 - Replay parser added. This means we can query HotSLogs if they have a replay without attempting to upload it. We also automatically know to prevent an upload for a replay that we know HotSLogs won't accept such as bot games.
- #47 - New data store. We now use an embedded database instead of a self-invented JSON File Store. This data store is upgradeable, so we can add new features to the information we store about replays.
- #16 - OSX tray icon has been integrated.

## Issues fixed
- ~~#11~~ - [Windows] Non-default Documents location. We now attempt to locate the Documents folder on Windows using native calls. This means we should always locate the replays with no extra user actions required.
- ~~#60~~ - Retry upload button feels unresponsive. An issue with the new retry/delete layout for replays added in 1.3.0 was found that made it really hard to click the retry upload button for a replay.
- ~~#44~~ - Account combobox looks different than hero selection combobox. Certain similar elements in the application looked different. This has now been fixed.
- ~~#3~~ - Application memory usage has been locked down. The application in an idle state will now attempt to severely restrict its memory usage

## Zhedar joins the team

This application has long been mostly a single-developer endeavour with a few key people helping out with issues @eivindveg could not fix alone, such as OSX issues. Between the release of 1.3.0 and 2.0.0, @zhedar has submitted [over 600 code changes](https://github.com/eivindveg/HotSUploader/commits?author=zhedar), which have increased code quality, fixed bugs, added new features and made it easier for other developers to work on this application. As such, zhedar has officially joined the team as OSX maintainer and general developer.

name: Version 1.3.1
body:
This is the release of version 1.3.1. This bugfix release fixes a few issues present in the design and layout as well as improving the memory foot-print, though still not optimal.

## Issues fixed
- ~~#40~~ - The replay list now displays failed replays at the bottom
- ~~#45~~ - The new replays list no longer goes white when empty
- ~~#46~~ - The list and status areas now have borders with the same colours
- #3 - Partial fix; the Java Heap Size has been reduced. This will trigger the garbage collection more often, but as an idle app, this shouldn't be a huge problem. If this causes no problems, we'll set an even more aggressive heap size.

## Known issues
- #11 - [Windows] A non-symlinked moved Documents folder will fail to display replays. See issue for workaround until this is fixed
- #16 - [OSX] Tray doesn't conform to standards and is disabled.
- #44 - Account selection box looks different than the Hero selection box

## Build information

Build is verified by [Travis-CI](https://travis-ci.org/eivindveg/HotSUploader/builds/87370638)

name: Version 1.3.0
body:
This is the release of version 1.3.0. This release features a redesigned theme based on [Flatter](http://www.guigarage.com/javafx-themes/flatter/), and drops references to replays that have previously been uploaded.

## New features in 1.3.0
- New layout
- New design

## Known issues
- #11 - [Windows] A non-symlinked moved Documents folder will fail to display replays. See issue for workaround until this is fixed
- #16 - [OSX] Tray doesn't conform to standards and is disabled.

## Build information

Build is verified by [Travis-CI](https://travis-ci.org/eivindveg/HotSUploader/builds/86484319)

name: Version 1.2.1
body:
This is the release of version 1.2.1. This is a critical bugfix release that resolves an internal S3 versioning issue. Version 1.2.0 has been pulled.

## Issues fixed in 1.2.1
- Fixed an issue where the datetime library joda-time was incompatible with Amazon S3 in java8u60 builds.

## Known issues
- #11 - [Windows] A non-symlinked moved Documents folder will fail to display replays. See issue for workaround until this is fixed
- #16 - [OSX] Tray doesn't conform to standards and is disabled.

name: Version 1.2.0[PULLED]
body:
This is the release of version 1.2.0. This is a feature release that improves upon the Hero select box.

## New features in 1.2.0
- #33 - Added autocompletion to the hero select box. You can now type in hero names to filter for quicker selection

## Issues fixed in 1.2.0
- #32  - Fixed an issue where the list of heroes did not retry population during a connection error

## Known issues
- #11 - [Windows] A non-symlinked moved Documents folder will fail to display replays. See issue for workaround until this is fixed
- #16 - [OSX] Tray doesn't conform to standards and is disabled.

name: Version 1.1.2
body:
This is the release of version 1.1.2. This is a bugfix release for an issue preventing the user closing the application on OSX.

## Issues fixed in 1.1.2
- #20 - Fixed a freeze upon close in OSX introduced in version 1.1

## Known issues
- #11 - [Windows] A non-symlinked moved Documents folder will fail to display replays. See issue for workaround until this is fixed
- #16 - [OSX] Tray doesn't conform to standards and is disabled.

name: Version 1.1.1
body:
This is the release of version 1.1.1. This is a bugfix release for multiple detected local accounts where the view would not update properly when a selected account did not have mmr ratings for a given game mode.

## Issues fixed in 1.1.1
- Fixed an issue where the MMR display would not update correctly with multiple accounts

## Known issues

#11 - [Windows] A non-symlinked moved Documents folder will fail to display replays. See issue for workaround until this is fixed
#16 - OSX Tray doesn't conform to standards and is disabled.
#20 - [OSX] Application freezes when trying to close it normally

name: Version 1.1
body:
This is the release of version 1.1. This release brings in a couple of quality of life features, as well as official experimental support for Ubuntu Linux. If you don't want to install the app, but rather run it as a Java application, we now also supply the .jar. Other variants of Linux may have luck just running the .jar!

## New Features
- [WINDOWS ONLY - MAC IS WIP] Close to tray: When closing the application, it'll live on in the tray, allowing you to pop up the window, or let it just run in the background, still uploading replays!
- Update notifications: A message will be displayed inside the UI when a new version of the application is available!
- Maintainability fixes: Groundwork has been laid down to make sure that when we need to make huge changes to how things work, we can simply upgrade the file store. No need to reupload!

## Issues fixed in 1.1

None

## Known issues

#11 - [Windows] A non-symlinked moved Documents folder will fail to display replays. See issue for workaround until this is fixed
#16 - OSX Tray doesn't conform to standards and is disabled.

name: Version 1.0 Release
body:
This is the release of version 1.0. No critical unfixed issues in release candidates have been discovered.

## Features
- Automatic discovery and upload to HotSLogs.com of all played games.
- Automatic discovery and upload of new replays while the client is running.
- Memory of uploaded replays through a JSON file store
- Polling of your player identity through HotSLogs.com and displays stats relevant to your BattleTag
- Polling of all released Heroes through HotSLogs.com with an option to display the Hero Details page for any individual Hero.
- Ability to directly open the HotSLogs.com profile search for any player you encounter
- Display of all discovered replays and their state
- Option to reupload replays that were tagged as "Exception" by HotSLogs.com

## Issues fixed in 1.0-RELEASE

None, however the code is somewhat more manageable.

## Known issues

#11 - [Windows] A non-symlinked moved Documents folder will fail to display replays. See issue for workaround until this is fixed

name: Version 1.0 Release Candidate 3
body:
This is a bugfix release candidate. It sorts out all known and verified issues in the RC2 build.

## Issues fixed in RC3
- #7 - WatchHandler now resets it state properly after aborting on a write cache file
- #10 - The Home Controller now properly encodes URLs with spaces

## Known issues
- Deleting replays, then playing a game without opening the application will trigger a dirty state for that replay name. Will not be fixed before 1.1

name: Version 1.0 Release Candidate 2
body:
This is our second RC build. It aims at reducing the download and install sizes, and accomplishes this by some degree(10-20%). However, the large Java Runtime Environment bundle size remains, which was also the vast majority in the previous release.

## New features since RC1

None

## Issues fixed since RC1
- #4 - smaller install and download size

## Known issues
- #7 - WatchHandler does not have a 100% hit rate after the first one. If a replay isn't discovered by the watcher, it'll be discovered the next time the application starts
- ~~#9 - Crash for users who haven't played any games~~
- #10 - Fails to open Hero Detail for heroes with spaces in their names

name: Version 1.0 Release Candidate 1
body:
This is our first RC build. It's considered stable for daily usage, but is not backed by unit or integration tests and therefore cannot be guaranteed to be entirely bug free.

## What happened to Beta 3?

This release candidate supercedes the unpublished beta3 release and incorporates its features.

## New features since Beta 2
- Native builds - this release is not released as a Java binary, but as installers for Windows and OSX
- Hero Details lookup - this feature is rolled up from beta3
- Small redesign - rolled up from beta3, you'll notice a larger, clickable banner that acts as a link directly to HotSLogs.com

## Fixed issues since Beta 2
- Fixed an issue where the uploader service would fail to restart if an issue with the upload occured
- Fixed an issue where the Regex matching for battle tags failed to account for longer than expected IDs
- Icons for OSX were fixed as part of the bundle cycle(no specific code)

## Known issues

None, feel free to report any bugs you find!

name: 1.0 BETA 2
body:
# First public release for distribution.

This release does not contain Windows and Mac OSX binaries yet.

## Known issues:

Failure to upload files without specificly knowing the underlying issue will fail the file handler service until restart.
